education.english_meaning: A room where a class of students is taught.
education.example: Our classroom is very clean.

education.english_meaning: A person who teaches, especially in a school.
education.example: The teacher is kind and helpful.

education.english_meaning: School work that a student is required to do at home.
education.example: I need to finish my homework today.

education.english_meaning: A person who is studying at a school or college.
education.example: The student raised her hand to ask a question.

education.english_meaning: A formal written, spoken or practical test.
education.example: I passed the math exam with good marks.

education.english_meaning: A written or printed work consisting of pages.
education.example: I read a book about animals.

education.english_meaning: A piece of furniture with a flat top for working at.
education.example: The desk is full of papers.

education.english_meaning: An instrument for writing or drawing.
education.example: Can I borrow a pencil?

education.english_meaning: An institution for educating children.
education.example: The school is very big.

education.english_meaning: A period of time in which a person is taught about a subject.
education.example: Today's lesson is about history.

education.english_meaning: A task or piece of work allocated to someone as part of a job or course of study.
education.example: The assignment is due next Monday.

education.english_meaning: An educational talk to an audience, especially one of students in a university.
education.example: The lecture was about world history.

education.english_meaning: A private teacher, typically one who teaches a single student or a very small group.
education.example: My tutor helped me understand algebra.

education.english_meaning: The subjects comprising a course of study in a school or college.
education.example: The curriculum includes practical lessons.

education.english_meaning: A mark indicating the quality of a student's work.
education.example: I got a good grade on my essay.

education.english_meaning: An individual or collaborative enterprise that is carefully planned to achieve a particular aim.
education.example: Our project is about renewable energy.

education.english_meaning: A small book with blank or ruled pages for writing notes in.
education.example: I wrote notes in my notebook.

education.english_meaning: A speech or talk in which a new product, idea, or piece of work is shown and explained.
education.example: Her presentation was impressive.

education.english_meaning: A set of printed or written questions with a choice of answers, devised for the purposes of a survey or statistical study.
education.example: The questionnaire was easy to complete.

education.english_meaning: The action of revising.
education.example: I spent the weekend on revision.

education.english_meaning: A grant or payment made to support a student's education, awarded on the basis of academic or other achievement.
education.example: She received a scholarship to study abroad.

education.english_meaning: A high-level educational institution in which students study for degrees and academic research is done.
education.example: He graduated from a prestigious university.

education.english_meaning: The practice of training people to obey rules or a code of behavior.
education.example: Discipline is key to success.

education.english_meaning: The systematic investigation into and study of materials and sources in order to establish facts and reach new conclusions.
education.example: The research took five years.

education.english_meaning: A long essay or dissertation involving personal research, written by a candidate for a university degree.
education.example: Her thesis was on renewable energy.

education.english_meaning: A temporary position with an emphasis on on-the-job training rather than merely employment.
education.example: The internship gave me practical experience.

education.english_meaning: A conference or other meeting for discussion or training.
education.example: I attended a seminar on technology.

education.english_meaning: The practice or science of collecting and analyzing numerical data in large quantities.
education.example: The statistics show a clear trend.

education.english_meaning: Detailed examination of the elements or structure of something.
education.example: The analysis provided new insights.

education.english_meaning: A source of information in order to ascertain something.
education.example: Use references to support your argument.

education.english_meaning: The method and practice of teaching, especially as an academic subject or theoretical concept.
education.example: Pedagogy is the art of teaching.

education.english_meaning: Relating to education and scholarship.
education.example: The academic year starts in September.

education.english_meaning: The practice of taking someone else's work or ideas and passing them off as one's own.
education.example: Plagiarism is a serious offense.

education.english_meaning: A long essay on a particular subject, especially one written for a university degree or diploma.
education.example: He defended his dissertation.

education.english_meaning: An outline of the subjects in a course of study or teaching.
education.example: The syllabus outlines topics.

education.english_meaning: Speaking several languages.
education.example: She is multilingual and speaks five languages.

education.english_meaning: Form a concept or idea of (something).
education.example: We need to conceptualize the idea before starting.

education.english_meaning: A system of methods used in a particular area of study or activity.
education.example: The methodology was clearly explained.

education.english_meaning: A list of the books referred to in a scholarly work.
education.example: The bibliography includes all the references used.

education.english_meaning: The making of a judgment about the amount, number, or value of something; assessment.
education.example: The evaluation process was fair.

education.english_meaning: The evaluation or estimation of the nature, quality, or ability of someone or something.
education.example: We conduct an assessment at the beginning of the school year.

education.english_meaning: An official document attesting a certain fact, in particular.
education.example: A student with a specific learning difficulty may need extra support.

education.english_meaning: A certificate awarded by an educational establishment to show that someone has successfully completed a course of study.
education.example: He has a diploma in hotel management.

education.english_meaning: A formal test of a person's knowledge or proficiency in a subject or skill.
education.example: Candidates are sorted out based on the results of a competitive examination.

education.english_meaning: An act of giving one thing and receiving another (especially of the same type or value) in return.
education.example: Our college has an exchange programme with one in Singapore.

education.english_meaning: The successful completion of a course of study at a university, college, or school, for which you receive a degree or diploma.
education.example: Some students struggle to find a good job after graduation.

education.english_meaning: A person who gives lectures, especially as a profession.
education.example: Dr John is the lecturer of this course.

education.english_meaning: A half-year term in a school or university, especially in North America, typically from September to December and January to May.
education.example: We have 5 subjects this semester.

education.english_meaning: Determine (the amount or number of something) mathematically.
education.example: There are tips that could help you calculate faster.

education.english_meaning: Give intellectual, moral, and social instruction to (someone), especially a child, typically at a school or university.
education.example: Students need to be educated on the dangers of driving without wearing helmets.

education.english_meaning: A point awarded for a correct answer or for proficiency in an examination or competition.
education.example: I hate marking written exam papers.

education.english_meaning: Commit to memory; learn by heart.
education.example: It is quite important to memorise all the maths formulas.

education.english_meaning: Give or award formally or ceremonially.
education.example: The principal presents the degree to the graduates.

education.english_meaning: Be entitled to a particular benefit or privilege by fulfilling a necessary condition.
education.example: If you have DELTA, you do qualify to teach English.

education.english_meaning: Examine and make corrections or alterations to (written or printed matter).
education.example: Do you think you can revise everything before the exam?

education.english_meaning: The number of points, goals, runs, etc. achieved in a game or competition.
education.example: He scored 9 in the English test.

education.english_meaning: Provide funds for (a project or activity or the person carrying it out).
education.example: Students who excel in sports tend to be sponsored by colleges.

education.english_meaning: Required by law or a rule; obligatory.
education.example: English is a compulsory subject at our school.

education.english_meaning: Consisting of many interconnecting parts or elements; intricate.
education.example: Some of the maths exercises were quite complicated.

education.english_meaning: Relating to the provision of education.
education.example: The organisation fought for women's educational rights.

education.english_meaning: Of or according to the rules of logic or formal argument.
education.example: At our centre, students practise constructing logical arguments daily.

education.english_meaning: (Of a question) accompanied by several possible answers, from which the candidate must choose the correct one.
education.example: The national English university entrance exam contains 50 multiple-choice items.

education.english_meaning: Of chief importance; principal.
education.example: The primary aim of this lesson is to improve your writing skills.

education.english_meaning: Able to be understood; intelligible.
education.example: His writing is quite comprehensible and well-organised.

education.english_meaning: Of or concerned with the actual doing or use of something rather than with theory and ideas.
education.example: The exercises need to be practical.

education.english_meaning: Consistently good in quality or performance; able to be trusted.
education.example: Is the test result reliable?

education.english_meaning: Education beyond secondary level, especially at a college or university.
education.example: I want to pursue higher education in the UK.

education.english_meaning: Knowledge of a broad range of subjects.
education.example: Unlike universities, the majority of schools focus on general knowledge.

education.english_meaning: A condition in the brain that causes difficulties comprehending or processing information.
education.example: Dyslexia is a common learning difficulty.

education.english_meaning: Learning conducted via electronic media, typically on the Internet.
education.example: During the pandemic, most education institutions switched to virtual learning.

education.english_meaning: An integrated set of interactive online services that provide trainers, learners, and others involved in education with information, tools, and resources to support and enhance education delivery and management.
education.example: Teachers could use a learning platform to assign homework for students.

education.english_meaning: Any resource—including print and non-print materials and online/digital resources—a teacher uses to help students learn.
education.example: Our learning materials are provided by the faculty.

education.english_meaning: A school where students are taught the skills they need to do a particular job.
education.example: Students can study at vocational schools for free.

education.english_meaning: A fee paid for instruction, especially at a college or private school.
education.example: Many colleges have raised their tuition fees.

education.english_meaning: Instruction in physical exercise and games, especially in schools.
education.example: Several students struggle with passing physical education courses.

education.english_meaning: Personal attributes that enable someone to interact effectively and harmoniously with other people.
education.example: Students should practise soft skills, such as presentation skills and problem-solving skills.

work.english_meaning: A paid position of regular employment.
A room or building used as a place for commercial, professional, or bureaucratic work.
work.example: The office is open from 9 to 5.

work.english_meaning: A person responsible for controlling or administering an organization or group of staff.
A person employed for wages or salary.
work.example: The employee completed the task on time.

work.english_meaning: A piece of work to be done or undertaken.
A person in charge of a worker or organization.
A fixed regular payment from an employer to an employee.
A group of people who work together.
Activity involving mental or physical effort done in order to achieve a purpose or result.
A short period of rest from work.
work.example: We take a short break after lunch.

work.english_meaning: A person with whom one works in a profession or business.
The latest time or date by which something should be completed.
work.example: We have to meet the deadline by Friday.

work.english_meaning: An occasion when people come together to discuss or decide something.
A speech or talk in which a new product, idea, or piece of work is shown and explained to an audience.
The action of raising someone to a higher position or rank.
work.example: He got a promotion last month.

work.english_meaning: A plan for carrying out a process or procedure, giving lists of intended events and times.
An individual or collaborative enterprise that is carefully planned to achieve a particular aim.
A group of people brought together to work on a particular task.
work.example: The taskforce handled the emergency well.

work.english_meaning: The action of teaching a person a particular skill or type of behavior.
work.example: The training session was very informative.

work.english_meaning: A written account of something that one has observed, heard, done, or investigated.
A temporary position with an emphasis on on-the-job training.
work.example: The internship provided me with valuable experience.

work.meaning: sự hài lòng trong công việc
work.english_meaning: A feeling of fulfillment or enjoyment that a person derives from their job.
work.example: Job satisfaction is essential for productivity.

work.english_meaning: The action or process of interacting with others to exchange information and develop professional or social contacts.
work.example: Networking is important in this industry.

work.english_meaning: A place where people work, such as an office or factory.
A written or spoken agreement, especially one concerning employment, sales, or tenancy, that is intended to be enforceable by law.
The accomplishment of a given task measured against preset known standards of accuracy, completeness, cost, and speed.
An act of retiring or giving up a position.
Discussion aimed at reaching an agreement.
work.example: Negotiation skills are vital for success.

work.english_meaning: A person who works freelance.
An advantage or profit gained from something.
work.example: The benefit package includes health insurance.

work.english_meaning: A person who sets up a business or businesses, taking on financial risks in the hope of profit.
work.example: The entrepreneur launched a new product.

work.english_meaning: The effectiveness of productive effort, especially in industry, as measured in terms of the rate of output per unit of input.
The action of leading a group of people or an organization.
The state or quality of being efficient.
work.example: Efficiency is key to reducing costs.

work.english_meaning: The action of supervising someone or something.
work.example: Supervision is necessary for large projects.

work.english_meaning: A plan of action designed to achieve a long-term or overall aim.
The action of finding new people to join an organization or support a cause.
work.example: Recruitment of new staff is ongoing.

work.english_meaning: Make (a company or organization) smaller by terminating the employment of a number of its employees.
The action of working with someone to produce something.
The amount of work to be done by a particular person or machine in a given period.

relationship.english_meaning: A person who you know well and who you like a lot.
A group consisting of parents and children living together in a household.
relationship.example: Family is very important to me.

relationship.english_meaning: An intense feeling of deep affection.
The legally or formally recognized union of two people as partners in a personal relationship.
Two people who are married or in a romantic relationship.
A father or mother.
A young human being below the age of puberty or below the legal age of majority.
relationship.example: The child is playing in the garden.

relationship.english_meaning: Each of two or more children or offspring having one or both parents in common; a brother or sister.
A person living near or next door to the speaker or person referred to.
The way in which two or more people or things are connected.
relationship.example: Our relationship has grown stronger over time.

relationship.english_meaning: A person's regular male companion with whom they have a romantic or sexual relationship.
A person's regular female companion with whom they have a romantic or sexual relationship.
Either member of a married couple or of an established unmarried couple.
A formal agreement to get married.
relationship.example: Their engagement was announced last week.

relationship.english_meaning: The legal dissolution of a marriage by a court or other competent body.
relationship.example: The couple went through a divorce.

relationship.english_meaning: The emotions or conduct of friends; the state of being friends.
relationship.example: Our friendship has lasted for years.

relationship.english_meaning: Give assistance to, especially financially; enable to function or act.
relationship.example: She provided emotional support during tough times.

relationship.english_meaning: Firm belief in the reliability, truth, or ability of someone or something.
relationship.example: Trust is the foundation of any relationship.

relationship.english_meaning: A relationship between people or groups based on shared feelings, interests, or experiences.
The state or feeling of being jealous.
A person one knows slightly, but who is not a close friend.
An agreement or settlement of a dispute that is reached by each side making concessions.
relationship.example: Compromise is necessary in any relationship.

relationship.english_meaning: The quality of being loyal to someone or something.
relationship.example: Loyalty is one of her best qualities.

relationship.english_meaning: A serious disagreement or argument, typically a protracted one.
The state or quality of being dedicated to a cause, activity, etc.
relationship.example: They made a commitment to stay together.

relationship.english_meaning: A gentle feeling of fondness or liking.
relationship.example: She shows great affection for her family.

relationship.english_meaning: The ability to understand and share the feelings of another.
The restoration of friendly relations.
The state of relying on or being controlled by someone or something else.
relationship.example: He has a dependency on his parents.

relationship.english_meaning: The quality of being trustworthy or of performing consistently well.
relationship.example: Reliability is essential in a team.

relationship.english_meaning: A state in which two things are able to exist or occur together without problems or conflict.
relationship.example: Compatibility is key in a long-term relationship.

relationship.english_meaning: Close familiarity or friendship; closeness.
The state or experience of being isolated from a group or an activity to which one should belong or in which one should be involved.
The fact of no longer being on friendly terms or part of a social group.
The quality or state of being exposed to the possibility of being attacked or harmed, either physically or emotionally.
A relationship in which one person enables another person's addiction, poor mental health, immaturity, irresponsibility, or under-achievement.
The dismissing or refusing of a proposal, idea, etc.
relationship.example: Rejection is a part of life.

relationship.english_meaning: The action or process of forgiving or being forgiven.
Affection, fondness, or sympathy for someone or something.
relationship.example: Attachment to memories can be emotional.

relationship.english_meaning: The state of being objective or aloof.

hobby.english_meaning: An activity done regularly in one's leisure time for pleasure.
Vocal or instrumental sounds combined in such a way as to produce beauty of form, harmony, and expression of emotion.
The action or skill of reading written or printed matter silently or aloud.
A picture or diagram made with a pencil, pen, or crayon rather than paint.
The practice or skill of preparing food by combining, mixing, and heating ingredients.
Moving rhythmically to music, typically following a set sequence of steps.
hobby.example: They often go dancing on weekends.

hobby.english_meaning: The action or skill of using paint, either in a picture or as decoration.
An activity involving physical exertion and skill in which an individual or team competes against another or others for entertainment.
The activity of tending and cultivating a garden, especially as a pastime.
Going from one place to another, typically over a distance of some length.
hobby.example: Traveling to new places excites me.

hobby.english_meaning: The art or process of taking photographs.
hobby.example: I took up photography last year.

hobby.english_meaning: Writing about a particular subject on a blog.
The activity of going for long walks, especially in the country or woods.
hobby.example: Hiking in the mountains is adventurous.

hobby.english_meaning: The craft or action of knitting.
The activity of catching fish, either for food or as a sport.
hobby.example: Fishing by the lake is peaceful.

hobby.english_meaning: The action of cooking food by dry heat without direct exposure to a flame, typically in an oven.
hobby.example: Baking cakes is her special talent.

hobby.english_meaning: A Hindu spiritual and ascetic discipline, a part of which, including breath control, simple meditation, and the adoption of specific bodily postures, is widely practiced for health and relaxation.
The sport or activity of riding a bicycle.
hobby.example: Cycling is a great way to explore.

hobby.english_meaning: The activity of spending a vacation living in a camp, tent, or camper.
hobby.example: Camping under the stars is magical.

hobby.english_meaning: The activity or skill of marking coherent words on paper and composing text.
hobby.example: Writing stories helps me express myself.

hobby.english_meaning: The activity or skill of making things from wood.
The craft of making pots, dishes, and other things made of baked clay.
The observation of birds in their natural habitat as a hobby.
Decorative handwriting or handwritten lettering.
The art of making two- or three-dimensional representative or abstract forms, especially by carving stone or wood or by casting metal or plaster.
A book with a photograph on the cover, or one containing many photographs.
The activity or hobby of making decorative articles by hand.
hobby.example: Crafting gifts for friends is fun.

hobby.english_meaning: A game of strategy played by moving pieces on a board.
hobby.example: We play board games every Friday.

hobby.english_meaning: The hobby of creating scrapbooks.
Freely offer to do something.
Photography of astronomical objects, celestial events, and areas of the night sky.
The Japanese art of folding paper into decorative shapes and figures.
The art or process of making jewelry.
hobby.example: Jewelry making combines art and craftsmanship.

hobby.english_meaning: The brewing of beer, ale, etc., on a small scale for private consumption.
(of a person or animal) search widely for food or provisions.
The keeping of bees, especially on a large scale.
Shopping for antiques.
hobby.example: Antiquing is a journey into history.

hobby.english_meaning: The recreational activity of hunting for and finding a hidden object by means of GPS coordinates posted on a website.
The process of working with metals to create individual parts, assemblies, or large-scale structures.
hobby.example: Metalworking is both challenging and rewarding.

hobby.english_meaning: The action of returning something to a former owner, place, or condition.
hobby.example: Restoration of old furniture brings it back to life.

weather.english_meaning: Moisture condensed from the atmosphere that falls visibly in separate drops.
The star around which the earth orbits.
A visible mass of water droplets suspended in the atmosphere.
weather.example: There are dark clouds in the sky.

weather.english_meaning: The perceptible natural movement of the air.
A violent disturbance of the atmosphere with strong winds and usually rain, thunder, lightning, or snow.
Atmospheric water vapor frozen into ice crystals and falling in light white flakes.
A thick cloud of tiny water droplets suspended in the atmosphere at or near the earth's surface which obscures or restricts visibility.
weather.example: The fog makes it hard to see.

weather.english_meaning: Of or at a low or relatively low temperature.
Having a high degree of heat or a high temperature.
The state of the atmosphere at a particular place and time as regards heat, cloudiness, dryness, sunshine, wind, rain, etc.
The degree or intensity of heat present in a substance or object.
The amount of water vapor in the air.
weather.example: High humidity makes it feel hotter.

weather.english_meaning: A prediction or estimate of future events, especially of the weather.
A gentle wind.
A prolonged period of abnormally hot weather.
A loud rumbling or crashing noise heard after a lightning flash due to the expansion of rapidly heated air.
weather.example: I heard thunder in the distance.

weather.english_meaning: The occurrence of a natural electrical discharge of very short duration and high voltage between a cloud and the ground or within a cloud.
Pellets of frozen rain which fall in showers from cumulonimbus clouds.
Light rain falling in very fine drops.
weather.example: There was light drizzle in the morning.

weather.english_meaning: A cloud of tiny water droplets suspended in the atmosphere at or near the earth's surface that limits visibility (but to a lesser extent than fog).
weather.example: The mist created a magical scene.

weather.english_meaning: The weather conditions prevailing in an area in general or over a long period.
A system of winds rotating inwards to an area of low atmospheric pressure.
weather.example: A cyclone hit the coastal area.

weather.english_meaning: A prolonged period of abnormally low rainfall, leading to a shortage of water.
weather.example: The drought dried up the river.

weather.english_meaning: A deposit of small white ice crystals formed on the ground or other surfaces when the temperature falls below freezing.
A very strong wind.
A seasonal prevailing wind in the region of South and Southeast Asia.
weather.example: The monsoon season brings heavy rain.

weather.english_meaning: Marked by a covering of gray clouds; dull.
weather.example: The sky is overcast with clouds.

weather.english_meaning: Rain, snow, sleet, or hail that falls to the ground.
weather.example: Precipitation levels are higher this year.

weather.english_meaning: The envelope of gases surrounding the earth or another planet.
weather.example: The atmosphere is filled with moisture.

weather.english_meaning: A severe snowstorm with high winds and low visibility.
The branch of science concerned with the processes and phenomena of the atmosphere, especially as a means of forecasting the weather.
A mass of snow, ice, and rocks falling rapidly down a mountainside.
A reversal of the normal behaviour of temperature in the troposphere, in which a layer of cool air at the surface is overlain by a layer of warmer air.
The climate of a very small or restricted area, especially when this differs from the climate of the surrounding area.
weather.example: A microclimate exists in urban areas.

weather.english_meaning: A line on a map connecting points having the same atmospheric pressure at a given time or on average over a given period.
weather.example: Isobars are lines of equal pressure.

weather.english_meaning: An instrument for measuring the speed of the wind, or of any current of gas.
The atmospheric temperature (varying according to pressure and humidity) below which water droplets begin to condense and dew can form.
weather.example: The dew point shows air saturation.

weather.english_meaning: The layer of the earth's atmosphere above the troposphere.
weather.example: The stratosphere is above the troposphere.

weather.english_meaning: A mobile, destructive vortex of violently rotating winds having the appearance of a funnel-shaped cloud.
A tropical storm with winds that have reached a constant speed of 74 miles per hour or more.
weather.example: Hurricanes are common in tropical areas.

technology.english_meaning: An electronic device for storing and processing data.
technology.example: I use a computer for work.

technology.english_meaning: A system for transmitting voices over a distance using wire or radio.
technology.example: She called me on her phone.

technology.english_meaning: A global computer network providing a variety of information and communication facilities.
technology.example: The internet is very fast here.

technology.english_meaning: Messages distributed by electronic means from one computer user to one or more recipients via a network.
technology.example: I sent an email to my teacher.

technology.english_meaning: A flat panel or area on an electronic device such as a television, computer, or smartphone, on which images and data are displayed.
A panel of keys that operate a computer or typewriter.
A hand-held pointing device that detects two-dimensional motion relative to a surface.
technology.example: I need a new mouse for my computer.

technology.english_meaning: A device for recording visual images in the form of photographs, film, or video signals.
A machine for printing text or pictures onto paper.
technology.example: The printer is out of ink.

technology.english_meaning: A self-contained program or piece of software designed to fulfill a particular purpose.
technology.example: I downloaded a new app for fitness.

technology.english_meaning: The programs and other operating information used by a computer.
The physical parts of a computer system.
technology.example: The hardware of this device is durable.

technology.english_meaning: A small mechanical or electronic device or tool, especially an ingenious or novel one.
Copy (data) from one computer system to another, typically over the internet.
technology.example: I downloaded the file from the website.

technology.english_meaning: Transfer (data) from one computer to another, typically to one that is larger or remote from the user or functioning as a server.
technology.example: She uploaded her photos to the cloud.

technology.english_meaning: A thing made or adapted for a particular purpose, especially a piece of mechanical or electronic equipment.
technology.example: This device can track your heart rate.

technology.english_meaning: A network of remote servers hosted on the Internet and used to store, manage, and process data.
technology.example: I saved all my files in the cloud.

technology.english_meaning: A facility allowing computers, smartphones, or other devices to connect to the Internet or communicate with one another wirelessly within a particular area.
A machine capable of carrying out a complex series of actions automatically.
technology.example: Robots are used in many factories.

technology.english_meaning: Not physically existing as such but made by software to appear to do so.
technology.example: This game creates a virtual world.

technology.english_meaning: A process or set of rules to be followed in calculations or other problem-solving operations, especially by a computer.
The process of converting information or data into a code, especially to prevent unauthorized access.
The state of being protected against the criminal or unauthorized use of electronic data.
The use of largely automatic equipment in a system of manufacturing or other production process.
The action or process of innovating.
The theory and development of computer systems able to perform tasks that normally require human intelligence.
Facts and statistics collected together for reference or analysis.
technology.example: Data is collected from various sources.

technology.english_meaning: A computer or computer program which manages access to a centralized resource or service in a network.
technology.example: The server is down for maintenance.

technology.english_meaning: A point where two systems, subjects, organizations, etc. meet and interact.
Relating to, using, or storing data or information in the form of digital signals.
The branch of technology that deals with dimensions and tolerances of less than 100 nanometers, especially the manipulation of individual atoms and molecules.
The exploitation of biological processes for industrial and other purposes, especially the genetic manipulation of microorganisms for the production of antibiotics, hormones, etc.
A type of computing that uses the quantum-mechanical phenomena, such as superposition and entanglement, to perform operations on data.
A technology that superimposes a computer-generated image on a user's view of the real world, thus providing a composite view.
technology.example: Augmented reality is used in gaming.

technology.english_meaning: A system in which a record of transactions made in bitcoin or another cryptocurrency are maintained across several computers that are linked in a peer-to-peer network.
technology.example: Blockchain is used for secure transactions.

technology.english_meaning: The action or process of making a physical object from a three-dimensional digital model, typically by laying down many thin layers of a material in succession.
A malicious and deliberate attempt by an individual or organization to breach the information system of another individual or organization.
technology.example: A cyberattack can cause major disruptions.

technology.english_meaning: A category of electronic devices that can be worn as accessories, embedded in clothing, implanted in the user's body, or even tattooed on the skin.
Extremely large data sets that may be analyzed computationally to reveal patterns, trends, and associations, especially relating to human behavior and interactions.

The use and development of computer systems that are able to learn and adapt without following explicit instructions, by using algorithms and statistical models to analyze and draw inferences from patterns in data.

health.english_meaning: A person with a medical degree whose job is to treat people who are ill or hurt.
health.example: The doctor gave me some medicine.

health.english_meaning: A person whose job is to care for people who are ill or injured, especially in a hospital.
health.example: The nurse checked my temperature.

health.english_meaning: A substance that is used in treating disease or relieving pain.
health.example: This medicine works quickly.

health.english_meaning: A place where people who are ill or injured are treated and taken care of by doctors and nurses.
health.example: The hospital is very clean.

health.english_meaning: A feeling of physical suffering caused by injury or illness.
health.example: He complained of chest pain.

health.english_meaning: The condition of the body and the degree to which it is free from illness, or the state of being well.
health.example: Health is the most important thing.

health.english_meaning: Affected by physical or mental illness.
health.example: She felt sick after eating seafood.

health.english_meaning: Activity requiring physical effort, carried out to sustain or improve health and fitness.
health.example: Exercise keeps you fit.

health.english_meaning: Any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink or that plants absorb in order to maintain life and growth.
health.example: We need healthy food to stay strong.

health.english_meaning: A condition of body and mind which typically recurs for several hours every night, in which the nervous system is inactive, the eyes closed, the postural muscles relaxed, and consciousness practically suspended.
health.example: Good sleep is essential for health.

health.english_meaning: The kinds of food that a person, animal, or community habitually eats.
health.example: She is on a special diet.

health.english_meaning: An instance of being injured.
health.example: The injury will heal in two weeks.

health.english_meaning: A state of mental or emotional strain or tension resulting from adverse or demanding circumstances.
health.example: Stress can affect your health.

health.english_meaning: A physical or mental feature which is regarded as indicating a condition of disease.
health.example: The symptoms started last week.

health.english_meaning: Medical care given to a patient for an illness or injury.
health.example: He is receiving treatment for cancer.

health.english_meaning: A return to a normal state of health, mind, or strength.
health.example: Her recovery was faster than expected.

health.english_meaning: A disorder of structure or function in a human, animal, or plant, especially one that produces specific signs or symptoms.
health.example: This disease is very rare.

health.english_meaning: A thorough medical examination to see if a person is healthy.
health.example: I go for a check-up every year.

health.english_meaning: A substance used to stimulate the production of antibodies and provide immunity against one or several diseases.
health.example: The vaccine is effective against the virus.

health.english_meaning: A continuous pain in the head.
health.example: He has a headache after working long hours.

health.english_meaning: A person’s condition with regard to their psychological and emotional well-being.
health.example: Mental health is as important as physical health.

health.english_meaning: The bodily system that protects the body from foreign substances, cells, and tissues by producing the immune response.
health.example: A strong immune system fights infections.

health.english_meaning: The process of infecting or the state of being infected.
health.example: The infection spread rapidly.

health.english_meaning: The treatment of injuries or disorders of the body by incision or manipulation with instruments.
health.example: The surgery was a success.

health.english_meaning: Treatment intended to relieve or heal a disorder.
health.example: He is in therapy for anxiety.

health.english_meaning: A compound of the sterol type found in most body tissues.
health.example: High cholesterol can cause heart problems.

health.english_meaning: The pressure of the blood in the circulatory system.
health.example: His blood pressure is normal.

health.english_meaning: A damaging immune response by the body to a substance, especially a particular food, pollen, fur, or dust, to which it has become hypersensitive.
health.example: She has a severe allergy to peanuts.

health.english_meaning: A medicine (such as penicillin or its derivatives) that inhibits the growth of or destroys microorganisms.
health.example: The doctor prescribed antibiotics.

health.english_meaning: The identification of the nature of an illness or other problem by examination of the symptoms.
health.example: The diagnosis confirmed the disease.

health.english_meaning: Relating to the heart and blood vessels.
health.example: Cardiovascular exercises strengthen the heart.

health.english_meaning: Relating to or affecting respiration or the organs of respiration.
health.example: Respiratory diseases are common in winter.

health.english_meaning: (of a disease or symptom) characterized by progressive, often irreversible deterioration, and loss of function in the organs or tissues.
health.example: The condition is degenerative over time.

health.english_meaning: Lack of proper nutrition, caused by not having enough to eat, not eating enough of the right things, or being unable to use the food that one does eat.
health.example: Malnutrition can lead to severe health problems.

health.english_meaning: A widespread occurrence of an infectious disease in a community at a particular time.
health.example: The epidemic spread across the region.

health.english_meaning: (of a disease) spread from one person or organism to another by direct or indirect contact.
health.example: Flu is highly contagious.

health.english_meaning: (of a disease) prevalent over a whole country or the world.
health.example: The pandemic affected the entire world.

health.english_meaning: Treatment with a vaccine to produce immunity against a disease; inoculation.
health.example: Vaccination campaigns have saved lives.

health.english_meaning: A state, period, or place of isolation in which people or animals that have arrived from elsewhere or been exposed to infectious or contagious disease are placed.
health.example: The patient was placed in quarantine.

health.english_meaning: The likely course of a disease or ailment.
health.example: The prognosis is positive for recovery.

house.english_meaning: A building for human habitation.
house.example: This house is very spacious.

house.english_meaning: A part or division of a building enclosed by walls, floor, and ceiling.
house.example: The room is well-lit.

house.english_meaning: A room or area equipped for preparing and cooking food.
house.example: She is cooking in the kitchen.

house.english_meaning: A room containing a toilet and sink and typically a bathtub or shower.
house.example: The bathroom has a shower.

house.english_meaning: A room for sleeping in.
house.example: Her bedroom is decorated in pink.

house.english_meaning: A room in a house for general and informal everyday use.
house.example: We watch TV in the living room.

house.english_meaning: A piece of ground, often near a house, used for growing flowers, fruit, or vegetables.
house.example: The garden is full of flowers.

house.english_meaning: An opening in the wall or roof of a building or vehicle that is fitted with glass or other transparent material in a frame to admit light or air and allow people to see out.
house.example: The window is open.

house.english_meaning: A hinged, sliding, or revolving barrier at the entrance to a building, room, or vehicle, or in the framework of a cupboard.
house.example: He knocked on the door.

house.english_meaning: A set of steps leading from one floor of a building to another.
house.example: Be careful on the stairs.

house.english_meaning: A platform enclosed by a wall or balustrade on the outside of a building, with access from an upper-floor window or door.
house.example: The balcony has a great view.

house.english_meaning: A building for housing a motor vehicle or vehicles.
house.example: The garage is used for storage.

house.english_meaning: The movable articles that are used to make a room or building suitable for living or working in.
house.example: We bought new furniture for the house.

house.english_meaning: The lower surface of a room, on which one may walk.
house.example: The floor is made of wood.

house.english_meaning: The upper interior surface of a room or other similar compartment.
house.example: The ceiling is painted white.

house.english_meaning: A continuous vertical brick or stone structure that encloses or divides an area of land.
house.example: The walls are decorated with pictures.

house.english_meaning: The structure forming the upper covering of a building or vehicle.
house.example: The roof was repaired last week.

house.english_meaning: A corridor or passage in a building.
house.example: The hallway leads to the bedrooms.

house.english_meaning: A space or room just below the roof of a building.
house.example: The attic is used for storage.

house.english_meaning: The floor of a building which is partly or entirely below ground level.
house.example: The basement is converted into a gym.

house.english_meaning: The art or practice of designing and constructing buildings.
house.example: Modern architecture emphasizes functionality.

house.english_meaning: The action of renovating a building.
house.example: The house needs renovation.

house.english_meaning: Material used to insulate something.
house.example: Good insulation keeps the house warm.

house.english_meaning: A building or buildings and the land belonging to it or them.
house.example: The property is near the city center.

house.english_meaning: A suite of rooms forming one residence, typically in a building containing a number of these.
house.example: The apartment is fully furnished.

house.english_meaning: A one-room apartment.
house.example: The studio is perfect for one person.

house.english_meaning: A paved area or platform next to a building; a patio or veranda.
house.example: We relaxed on the terrace.

house.english_meaning: A vertical channel or pipe which conducts smoke and combustion gases up from a fire or furnace and typically through the roof of a building.
house.example: Smoke was coming out of the chimney.

house.english_meaning: The system of pipes, drains, fittings, valves, and fixtures for the distribution of water for drinking, heating, and washing, and the removal of waterborne wastes.
house.example: The plumbing system needs maintenance.

house.english_meaning: Improving the aesthetic appearance of (a piece of land) by changing its contours, adding ornamental features, or planting trees and shrubs.
house.example: The landscaping enhances the house's beauty.

house.english_meaning: A set of principles concerned with the nature and appreciation of beauty, especially in art.
house.example: Aesthetics play a crucial role in design.

house.english_meaning: A trend in sculpture and painting that arose in the 1950s and used simple, typically massive, forms.
house.example: Minimalism is a popular trend in home decor.

house.english_meaning: The ability to be maintained at a certain rate or level.
house.example: Sustainability is key in construction.

house.english_meaning: An expensive and comfortable flat or set of rooms at the top of a tall building.
house.example: The penthouse offers a stunning view.

house.english_meaning: A large country house with lands.
house.example: The manor is surrounded by lush gardens.

house.english_meaning: A low house, with a broad front porch, without an upper floor or with rooms set in the roof.
house.example: They live in a cozy bungalow.

house.english_meaning: A large and luxurious country house in its own grounds.
house.example: The villa is located by the sea.

house.english_meaning: A residential building divided into two apartments.
house.example: The duplex is shared by two families.

house.english_meaning: The art and science of enhancing the interior of a building to achieve a healthier and more aesthetically pleasing environment for the people using the space.
house.example: Interior design focuses on function and beauty.

house.english_meaning: The use of control systems, such as computers or remote controls, to operate a home's appliances and features.
house.example: Home automation makes life convenient.

environment.english_meaning: A woody perennial plant, typically having a single stem or trunk growing to a considerable height.
environment.example: The tree is very tall.

environment.english_meaning: A large natural stream of water flowing in a channel to the sea, a lake, or another river.
environment.example: The river flows through the village.

environment.english_meaning: A large natural elevation of the earth's surface rising abruptly from the surrounding level.
environment.example: The mountain is covered with snow.

environment.english_meaning: A large area covered chiefly with trees and undergrowth.
environment.example: We went hiking in the forest.

environment.english_meaning: A pebbly or sandy shore, especially by the ocean between high- and low-water marks.
environment.example: The beach is crowded during summer.

environment.english_meaning: A large body of water surrounded by land.
environment.example: We had a picnic by the lake.

environment.english_meaning: A very large expanse of sea, in particular each of the main areas into which the sea is divided geographically.
environment.example: The ocean is vast and beautiful.

environment.english_meaning: The invisible gaseous substance surrounding the earth, a mixture mainly of oxygen and nitrogen.
environment.example: Clean air is essential for health.

environment.english_meaning: Vegetation consisting of typically short plants with long, narrow leaves, growing wild or cultivated on lawns and pasture.
environment.example: The grass is green after the rain.

environment.english_meaning: The phenomena of the physical world collectively, including plants, animals, the landscape, and other features and products of the earth, as opposed to humans or human creations.
environment.example: Nature is full of wonders.

environment.english_meaning: The presence in or introduction into the environment of a substance which has harmful or poisonous effects.
environment.example: Pollution harms the environment.

environment.english_meaning: Convert (waste) into reusable material.
environment.example: We recycle paper to reduce waste.

environment.english_meaning: Wild animals collectively; the native fauna (and sometimes flora) of a region.
environment.example: Wildlife needs protection from humans.

environment.english_meaning: The weather conditions prevailing in an area in general or over a long period.
environment.example: Climate change is a global issue.

environment.english_meaning: The strength and vitality required for sustained physical or mental activity.
environment.example: Solar energy is renewable.

environment.english_meaning: A synthetic material made from a wide range of organic polymers that can be molded into shape while soft and then set into a rigid or slightly elastic form.
environment.example: Plastic takes years to decompose.

environment.english_meaning: Material that is not wanted; the unusable remains or byproducts of something.
environment.example: Waste management is crucial in cities.

environment.english_meaning: A biological community of interacting organisms and their physical environment.
environment.example: The ecosystem is delicate and needs care.

environment.english_meaning: The natural home or environment of an animal, plant, or other organism.
environment.example: The polar bear's habitat is melting.

environment.english_meaning: A gradual increase in the overall temperature of the earth's atmosphere generally attributed to the greenhouse effect.
environment.example: Global warming affects all life forms.

environment.english_meaning: The protection of animals, plants, and natural resources.
environment.example: Conservation efforts help save endangered species.

environment.english_meaning: The ability to be maintained at a certain rate or level.
environment.example: Sustainability is key for future generations.

environment.english_meaning: The clearing of trees, transforming a forest into cleared land.
environment.example: Deforestation leads to loss of biodiversity.

environment.english_meaning: The variety of life in the world or in a particular habitat or ecosystem.
environment.example: Biodiversity ensures ecosystem balance.

environment.english_meaning: The amount of carbon dioxide released into the atmosphere as a result of the activities of a particular individual, organization, or community.
environment.example: Reducing your carbon footprint is important.

environment.english_meaning: (of a natural resource or source of energy) not depleted when used.
environment.example: Renewable resources are eco-friendly.

environment.english_meaning: The state or process of a species, family, or larger group being or becoming extinct.
environment.example: Many species face extinction due to habitat loss.

environment.english_meaning: A natural fuel such as coal or gas, formed in the geological past from the remains of living organisms.
environment.example: Fossil fuels contribute to global warming.

environment.english_meaning: A substance that pollutes something, especially water or the atmosphere.
environment.example: Factories release pollutants into the air.

environment.english_meaning: A natural event such as a flood, earthquake, or hurricane that causes great damage or loss of life.
environment.example: Natural disasters can devastate entire regions.

environment.english_meaning: The branch of biology that deals with the relations of organisms to one another and to their physical surroundings.
environment.example: Ecology studies the relationships in nature.

environment.english_meaning: The deterioration of the environment through depletion of resources such as air, water and soil.
environment.example: Environmental degradation is a serious problem.

environment.english_meaning: The condition of being populated with excessively large numbers.
environment.example: Overpopulation puts pressure on resources.

environment.english_meaning: Economic development that is conducted without depletion of natural resources.
environment.example: Sustainable development balances economy and ecology.

environment.english_meaning: The trapping of the sun's warmth in a planet's lower atmosphere.
environment.example: The greenhouse effect contributes to climate change.

environment.english_meaning: Extremely small pieces of plastic debris in the environment resulting from the disposal and breakdown of consumer products and industrial waste.
environment.example: Microplastics are found in oceans worldwide.

environment.english_meaning: The process of making an area more urban.
environment.example: Urbanization changes the natural landscape.

environment.english_meaning: A method of crop and livestock production that involves much more than choosing not to use pesticides, fertilizers, genetically modified organisms, antibiotics and growth hormones.
environment.example: Organic farming avoids synthetic chemicals.

environment.english_meaning: Understanding the importance of the environment and making choices that benefit the earth, rather than hurt it.
environment.example: Environmental awareness is increasing globally.

environment.english_meaning: A state of net-zero carbon dioxide emissions.
environment.example: Carbon neutrality is a goal for many countries.

travel/transport.english_meaning: A road vehicle, typically with four wheels, powered by an internal combustion engine or electric motor and able to carry a small number of people.
travel/transport.example: I bought a new car last week.

travel/transport.english_meaning: A large motor vehicle carrying passengers by road, typically one serving the public on a fixed route and for a fare.
travel/transport.example: The bus is late today.

travel/transport.english_meaning: A series of connected railway carriages or wagons moved by a locomotive or by integral motors.
travel/transport.example: She travels by train every weekend.

travel/transport.english_meaning: A powered flying vehicle with fixed wings and a weight greater than that of the air it displaces, driven forward by propellers or jet engines.
travel/transport.example: The plane is ready for takeoff.

travel/transport.english_meaning: A bicycle or motorcycle.
travel/transport.example: I ride my bike to school.

travel/transport.english_meaning: A vessel for travel on water, propelled by oars, sails, or an engine.
travel/transport.example: We crossed the river by boat.

travel/transport.english_meaning: A motor vehicle licensed to transport passengers in return for payment of a fare.
travel/transport.example: He called a taxi to go to the airport.

travel/transport.english_meaning: A wide way leading from one place to another, especially one with a specially prepared surface which vehicles can use.
travel/transport.example: The road is under construction.

travel/transport.english_meaning: A piece of paper or small card that gives the holder a certain right, as to enter a place, travel by public transport, or participate in an event.
travel/transport.example: Please show me your ticket.

travel/transport.english_meaning: A diagrammatic representation of an area of land or sea showing physical features, cities, roads, etc.
travel/transport.example: The map shows all the local attractions.

travel/transport.english_meaning: An act of traveling from one place to another.
travel/transport.example: The journey took three hours.

travel/transport.english_meaning: A traveler on a public or private conveyance other than the driver, pilot, or crew.
travel/transport.example: The passenger asked for a window seat.

travel/transport.english_meaning: A person who drives a vehicle.
travel/transport.example: The driver was very polite.

travel/transport.english_meaning: A regular stopping place on a public transport route, especially one on a railway line.
travel/transport.example: The train arrived at the station on time.

travel/transport.english_meaning: Suitcases or other bags in which to pack personal belongings for traveling.
travel/transport.example: I forgot to pack my luggage.

travel/transport.english_meaning: A journey made by air, especially in an airplane.
travel/transport.example: Our flight has been delayed.

travel/transport.english_meaning: The place to which someone or something is going or being sent.
travel/transport.example: Paris is our next destination.

travel/transport.english_meaning: A boat or ship for conveying passengers and goods, especially over a relatively short distance and as a regular service.
travel/transport.example: We took a ferry across the sea.

travel/transport.english_meaning: A raised level surface on which people or things can stand.
travel/transport.example: Wait for me on the platform.

travel/transport.english_meaning: An underground electric railway.
travel/transport.example: The subway is the fastest way to get downtown.

travel/transport.english_meaning: The movement of humans, animals or goods from one location to another.
travel/transport.example: Transportation in big cities can be challenging.

travel/transport.english_meaning: Travel some distance between one's home and place of work on a regular basis.
travel/transport.example: I commute to work by bus every day.

travel/transport.english_meaning: The process or activity of accurately ascertaining one's position and planning and following a route.
travel/transport.example: Navigation apps are helpful for drivers.

travel/transport.english_meaning: A planned route or journey.
travel/transport.example: Our itinerary includes visits to landmarks.

travel/transport.english_meaning: The activity of visiting places of interest in a particular location.
travel/transport.example: We spent the afternoon sightseeing.

travel/transport.english_meaning: The sharing of car journeys so that more than one person travels in a car.
travel/transport.example: Carpooling reduces traffic and pollution.

travel/transport.english_meaning: The action of leaving, especially to start a journey.
travel/transport.example: The departure time has been changed.

travel/transport.english_meaning: The action or process of arriving.
travel/transport.example: We arrived at the airport early.

travel/transport.english_meaning: A two-wheeled vehicle that is powered by a motor and has no pedals.
travel/transport.example: Motorcycles are popular in this region.

travel/transport.english_meaning: A main road, especially one connecting major towns or cities.
travel/transport.example: The new highway connects major cities.

travel/transport.english_meaning: The flying or operating of aircraft.
travel/transport.example: Aviation plays a crucial role in travel.

travel/transport.english_meaning: The official department that administers and collects the duties levied by a government on imported goods.
travel/transport.example: You must declare items at customs.

travel/transport.english_meaning: The action of coming to live permanently in a foreign country.
travel/transport.example: Immigration took a long time.

travel/transport.english_meaning: A journey undertaken by a group of people with a particular purpose, especially that of exploration, research, or war.
travel/transport.example: The expedition explored the rainforest.

travel/transport.english_meaning: A period of rest or waiting before a further stage in a journey.
travel/transport.example: We had a layover in Singapore.

travel/transport.english_meaning: Traveling or hiking with a backpack.
travel/transport.example: Backpacking through Europe was unforgettable.

travel/transport.english_meaning: A voyage on a ship or boat taken for pleasure or as a holiday and visiting several places.
travel/transport.example: The cruise stopped at several islands.

travel/transport.english_meaning: Travel by getting free lifts in passing vehicles.
travel/transport.example: Hitchhiking can be risky but fun.

travel/transport.english_meaning: The transport of people and goods within cities.
travel/transport.example: Urban transport is improving.

travel/transport.english_meaning: Travel that is environmentally, socially, and economically sustainable.
travel/transport.example: Sustainable travel reduces environmental impact.
